section.title: Extending the Available Size of a Virtual Disk
section.para: You can extend the available size of a virtual disk while the virtual disk is attached to a virtual machine. Resizing a virtual disk does not resize the underlying partitions or file systems on that virtual disk. Use the fdisk utility to resize the partitions and file systems as required. See How to Resize a Partition using fdisk for more information.

procedure.title: Extending the Available Size of Virtual Disks

step.para: Click the Virtual Machines tab and select a virtual machine.
Click the Disks tab in the details pane and select the disk to edit.
Enter a value in the Extend size by(GB) field.

section.para: The target disk's status becomes locked for a short time, during which the drive is resized. When the resizing of the drive is complete, the status of the drive becomes OK.
